intro: Corchorus microphyllus, commonly known as littleleaf dock, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features upright stems with broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces capsules that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can be used in herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
